data.name: Jungerstein's Math Training Room: 4. O Pascal tree, how green are your leaves?
data.description:
Pascal triangle / Yang Hui triangle is a rather familiar topic in various katas. However, in this kata, the problem is very simple (but an effecient solutio n is appreciated). Imagine the triangle is a pine, and a value as a leaf. Here we call the summit as Line 0, and below is Line 1, etc. In each line, there is Point 0, Point 1, ... etc. In this way, the value in Line n and Point k should be 
  k
C 
  n,
or 
( n )
( k ).
In the tree here, if the value of a point is odd, we see it as a green leaf; if even, a yellow one. A green leaf will have the colour code 1, and a yellow leave, 0. Please judge the colour code of a leaf (n, k). Example: 
colour_leaf(3, 2) = 1   # As C(3, 2) = 3, it is green, so return 1.
If possible, please refrain yourself from using large number operation in Python. Do you have a smart solution? For example, does an O(log n) algorithm exist? [I can prove one. In C, the standard judgement is it. In Python, I had not proved it when I drafted the kata, so a slower but sure solution is there for random tests. ] If you discover some patterns, can you prove them? [Of course, the kata judgement does not judge your mathematical proof. ]
